form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Toomey introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of funds for United States participation in joint military exercises with Egypt if the Government of Egypt abrogates, terminates, or withdraws from the 1979 Egypt-Israel peace treaty.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Conditioning United States-Egypt Military Exercises Act of 2013 .

section.header: Contingent limitation on availability of funds for United States participation in joint military exercises with Egypt

subsection.text: No amounts appropriated or otherwise made available for the United States Government may be used for United States participation in joint military exercises with Egypt if the Government of Egypt abrogates, terminates, or withdraws from the 1979 Egypt-Israel peace treaty signed at Washington, DC, on March 26, 1979.
The President may waive the limitation in subsection (a) if the President certifies to Congress in writing that the waiver is in the national security interests of the United States.
